Stepchild is a VST step sequencer, allowing you to edit sequences in a buffer using left and right clicks of the mouse. Originally designed for Tracktion, Stepchild now works in most VST hosts. 
 All patterns can be triggered via MIDI. Triggering patterns may be turned OFF/ON. Drag and drop export of MIDI patterns.

Metal Mickey.name: Metal Mickey
Metal Mickey.description:
Metal Mickey is a synced delay sequencer with a unique 'character' sound. 
Features include: 
An 8 step sequencer synced to tempo with a number of features - random stepping, multiplication and division of speed, adjustable slide (from one value to the next) and an adjustable loop point. The sequencer controls the delay time and feedback. Tuning of high delay times. 3 filters. 2 LFOs. Full VST and midi automation.

The The Four.name: The The Four
The The Four.description:
Synth Edit Drum Module VSTi based on WJ Alesis D4 Soundfont found here.
 Contains all of the original kits of Alesis D4. Low CPU Use.

Gargoyle.name: Gargoyle
Gargoyle.description: Inspired by a request for a VST that could be used for a Horror film Soundtrack. This synth is dedicated to its namesake. A guy whose generosity knows no bounds. This Plug is most likely the work of the D*v*l himself...

Morphiza.name: Morphiza
Morphiza.description: Styled after the Transistor organs of the 60s and 70s, this organ synth avoids the drawbar analogy and instead provides a series of harmonic tone and boost knobs to provide a rich and varied palette of tones.

Richman.name: Richman
Richman.description:
Using a hybrid of Physical Modelling and FM synthesis, Richman2 is designed to be an expressive plug-in, which in the right hands can make real sounding and organic sounds. 
Specializing in plucked or struck tones Richman2 can also turn its hand to a great many other types of sounds. It comes complete with 100 preset to demonstrate its capabilities.

S.F.U.M..name: S.F.U.M.
S.F.U.M..description: A Riotous noisemaker, using the host sync feature to scan through a series of 8 amplitude levels and sweep amounts and then mangling the synths waveforms using the Twist control. The Glide Control evens out the pitch changes and the Smooth control takes some of the upper harmonics off. This synth is very much one for the experimenters out there.

4Front Rhode.name: 4Front Rhode
4Front Rhode.description: 4Front Rhode is a CPU-lightweight vintage Rhodes-type piano module with a gentle overdrive. This module reproduces the classic sound similar to RSP73 pianos. The sound generation is not based upon samples, thus there are 127 continuous layers provided with a vintage rhodes smooth overdrive.

microTERA.name: microTERA
microTERA.description:
microTERA for Windows and Mac OS X is available free exclusively on the CD cover disc of several magazines - German magazine Keys & Music Tech in the UK.
The iPad version is available to purchase in the App Store.
Features (Mac & Win):
Additive Waveshaping Synthesizer (Mixture between VirSyn Cube and VirSyn TERA). 3 Oscillators (Sinus, Tune & Fine-Tune, individual Lever-Potis, Pitch and Level can be modulated). 32 Voices per Instance. Portamento. Spread-Mode. 2 LFOs (Rate, Sync to Part & MIDI & Voice & Key, Waveforms: Sine, Triangle, Square, Ramp up, Ramp down, S&H, Random). 2 Multi segment Envelopes, each Envelope can have 64 segments. On-Screen Keyboard with Modulation wheel and Pitch-Bend (Range up to -/+ 36 Octaves). The heart of the microTERA: the Additive Shaper with Spectrum and Noise Parameter. 3 effects: Distortion, Delay, Modulation. Amp Section: Level and Pan can be modulated, LoFi-FX (Bit reducer and Sampling rate Reducer). 128 Presets. The well known Slotmachine: "intelligent" Randomize Function. 
Features (iPad):
Waveshaping Synthesizer: Wavehaper with user programmable shape. Spectral shape specification. Three sine oscillators. Feedback input for noise components. 4 Low frequency oscillators. 4 Envelopes with tempo sync. 64 time/level segments per envelope. Monophonic or polyphonic with 16 voices. More than 160 factory presets, unlimited user presets can be shared.  FX: Chorus with four delay lines. 8 pole Analog Phaser. Distortion effect with Tube/Tape emulation. Stereo Echo/Delay effect. Hi end reverberation unit.  Live: Play melodies live with the onscreen keyboard. Drag fingers for slides and vibrato. Optionally use CoreMIDI* compatible hardware keyboard. Dozens of scales selectable. Variable Keyboard layout for scale optimized playing. Full featured programmable Arpeggiator. Uses programmable sequences with up to 32 steps. Can trigger single notes and chords. Unique randomizer generates Arpeggios with 100% usability. 32 Arpeggios included, unlimited user arpeggios possible. For each step you can program tie, accent, transposition and note order.  Global: Audiobus compatible (Input slot). Inter App Audio. Audio pasteboard. Copy audio recordings to Clipboard for use with other Apps (e.g. Intua BeatMaker and many others). Exchange user presets with File Sharing in iTunes. Support for virtual MIDI input connections. Publish loops and recordings online with the SoundCloud audio platform.  
Price: $9.99 in the App Store.
{See video at top of page}

Ambience.name: Ambience
Ambience.description:
By Magnus @ Smartelectronix.
Ambience is a free reverb that rivals the quality of the best commercial reverbs.

Superwave P8.name: Superwave P8
Superwave P8.description:
SuperWave P8 is a virtual analogue synthesizer. 
 Oscillators: 
2 Oscillators: Single, Dual, 7 Oscillators SuperWave mode. Waveforms: Sine, Saw, Ramp, Triangle, Pulse, White Noise, Pink Noise. Controls: Waveform, Mode, Fine-Tune, Semi-Tune, Detune, Octave, Sync. 
 Filters: 
2 Resonant Filters: 12dB. Filter Types: Low Pass, Band Pass, High Pass. Controls: Filter Type, Cutoff Frequency, Resonance, Key Follow, Lock (Cutoff Frequency). 
 Amplifiers: 
2 Amplifiers. Controls: Level, Pan, On/Off. 
 Envelopes: 
4 Envelopes (Filter x2, Amp x2). Controls: Depth, Attack, Decay, Sustain, Release. 
 Low Frequency Oscillators: 
2 LFOs with multiple routing options. Waveforms: Sine, Saw, Ramp, Triangle, Pulse, White Noise, Pink Noise. Beat Ratios: 10. Controls: Waveform, Destination, Mode, Rate, Beat, Depth, Key On, Route. 
 Modulation: 
Modulation with multiple routing options. Controls: Input, Destination, Depth. 
 Effects: 
Effect Types: Mono Delay x2 (1 Stereo pair). 
 Other Features: 
8 note polyphonic operation. Main volume control. Mono/Polyphonic control. Portamento control. MIDI CC control with learn capability. 64 high quality presets.

X-cita.name: X-cita
X-cita.description:
Analog style exciter for mastering purposes, inspired on the BBE Maximizer models.
 Warm sound and very simple to use, this exciter can be very useful to add some subtle brightness in the high frequencies, and make the lows more dense. It has been conceived to be used mainly on the mastering stage, but it's also useful for individual tracks. Independent controls for Low and High frequencies, bypass and global Volume Out. Completely automatable via MIDI CC (Controls 20,21,22,23,24). Moderate CPU use (-8% Athlon XP 2400+). Includes 6 presets.

UltraPhazer.name: UltraPhazer
UltraPhazer.description:
UltraPhazer is a multi oscillated phaser plugin for Windows and OS X hosts. It sounds very cool on guitar tracks and on raw saw sound. But also a very subtle phazer effect can be generated with this plugin. It can also be used as stereo enhancer and auto panner.
There are a lot of controls for the parameters: Resonance, Min Filter, Max Filter, LFO Freq, LFO Add 1-3, Filter 1-4, Num Filter, Stereo Phaz and Mix.
 Changes in v1.5 beta:
Fixed default bank corruption error in 64-bit mode / OS X. TODO: Fixed missing GUI update in 64-bit mode / OS X using some hosts like Renoise 2.81 
Changes in v1.4:
Added VSTGUI 4.1 beta support. Added Cocoa support. Added 64-bit support. Optimized anti-denormal algorithm. Various optimizations. No more PowerPC support. Ask us for a special build, if you really need it. Minimum OS X version: 10.5.

Elite Reducer 2.name: Elite Reducer 2
Elite Reducer 2.description:
Elite Reducer 2 is a sample rate / bit rate VST reducer with two resonant low pass filters and a special logical values combination algorithm.
It features an automatic bank loader and a handy GUI which makes it easy to automate the reducer's values. Elite Reducer is very useful to for adding a powerful distorted sound to beat constructions. It sounds also very good on acid basses and atmospheric sounds.
Digital computer lofi sounds can be created with reducer easily. Reducer as group master effect can be used as a filter.
Version 2 now comes with 3 interpolation algorithms, lp/hp filters, 2 bit reducers and improvements.
Changes in v2.2 beta:
Fixed default bank corruption error in 64-bit mode / OS X. TODO: Fixed missing GUI update in 64-bit mode / OS X using some hosts like Renoise 2.81. 
Changes in v2.1:
First OS X build. Added VSTGUI 4.1 beta support. Added Cocoa support. Added 64-bit support in 32-bit processing mode. Optimized anti-denormal algorithm. Improved rate reducer. Improved bit reducer. Interpolation variants are now: Linear, B-Spline and Fake-Sin. Various optimizations. New much better default presets. Minimum OS X version now: 10.5.

Lallapallooza lite.name: Lallapallooza lite
Lallapallooza lite.description: 3 Oscillators (OSC1 have "SuperSAW" wave by 7 SAW waves. 9 Types). 5 Filter Types. 3 LFO (BPMsynced / Manual, LFO3 for ModWheel), 2 Modulations. 2 Envelopes (Amp / Filter), 2 Modulations. Effects (2 pingpongDELAY, Overdrive, EQ). Arpeggiator, Portamento, 8 notes Poly / Mono. MIDI automation

Deelay.name: Deelay
Deelay.description: Six delay lines with multimode filter and panning per delay. Synced or manual delay time controls, delay time up to 80 seconds. Buttons to deactivate the delay, mute the input or choose L or R as input. Delay routing. Internal limiters on every delay to be able to create distorted feedbacks without blowing up your speakers. PANIC button to lower all feedbacks at once. Input button: Turns input On/Off. Hints on all controls that makes the plug pretty self explanatory. MIDI automation and MIDI learn.

R2.name: R2
R2.description: R2 is a hybrid synth and effect processor, just assign a MIDI track to it to play notes and use an external source (preferably voice) to make the pitch change. You can achieve interesting sounds with this plug, besides the famous Star Wars R2-D2 blips you can use it as a synth and use your voice to make weird vibratos.

WoW!.name: WoW!
WoW!.description:
An SV filter with peak follower, there's also a "sample and hold" module that makes peaks sound steppy, you can also sequence the filter frequency via MIDI keyboard messages.
Features:
HighPass, LowPass, BandPass, BandReject type filters. Two gain controls ("In" "Out") to fine adjust levels and avoid any clipping. Attack/Decay controls for the peak follower. Sample and hold module, Freq and Pulse width controls. MIDI controlled filter gate and a ADSR envelope to shape it. 
WoWST (Pictured above) is the Stereo version of "WoW!" with double everything.

WNM-1fx.name: WNM-1fx
WNM-1fx.description:
This is a VST/FX based on the same principles as the WNM-1 synth but this time you can modulate anything you feed in.
One module of six oscillators, first five are modulators and can be routed to other oscillators. Sine, Saw, Ramp, Triangle, Pulse, w-noise and p-noise waveforms to choose from. Freq, Pulse Width and Modulation depth for each oscillator. Stereo support.

Multiband StereoFaker.name: Multiband StereoFaker
Multiband StereoFaker.description: Multiband StereoFaker uses a six bands filter to spread a mono signal to "fake" stereo signal, it has panning+LFO on every band so you can make dynamic effects, you can make slow and subtle changes as well as making extreme panning modulation, it works great on drumloops and strings and it works specially nice on synths.

MicroGater.name: MicroGater
MicroGater.description: Simple MIDI gate with invert button and ASR envelope. In normal mode it works as a regular gate, in inverted mode when you play a note it will lower the volume, this is useful to create a controlled pumping effect like when using a side chain compressor.

AnalogDelay.name: AnalogDelay
AnalogDelay.description:
By mdsp @ Smartelectronix.
AnalogDelay is a delay unit followed by a 2nd order lowpass filter with saturation. The delay-time can evolve between 0 and max-delay which lets you be very accurate.
You can also synchronise the delay to the tempo with different resolutions from 1/128 to 1 bar and control the way the delay-time is interpolated with the kind of interpolation and the time-constant.

Creakbox.name: Creakbox
Creakbox.description:
Creakbox Bassline is a 303 like mono synth with a built in sequencer. 
Features: 
1 oscillator (Square/Saw). Resonant filter. Envelope mode & Decay. Accent. Slide(Glide). Step sequencer with a 5 octave range (Can be set to a BPM (40 - 300) or to Sync with your sequencer).

SIR1.name: SIR1
SIR1.description:
SIR1 is a reverb device that works with "impulse-responses". Impulse-responses are generated by recording short, broadband signals and their corresponding room-reflections, and by cutting out the initial signal. What is left contains the information needed to reproduce the same room with other signals.
Features:
Works with a fixed latency of 8960 samples (possibly compensated by VST-Host). You can adjust predelay, attack-time, length and stereo width of the impulse response. Stretch (up & downsampling of impulse response). FFT EQ (to adjust the frequency spectrum of the impulse-response). Auto Gain (automatic volume compensation). Dynamic CPU Consumption (use only the CPU power that is needed to get the result).

LOFI.name: LOFI
LOFI.description:
LOFI is a VST effect, created to downgrade your audio. Sometimes a track needs a little 'dirt' to make it sound alive. With LOFI you can easily downgrade your clean sounds to old dirty sounding samples. 
Features: 
Downscaler (pitch shifting). Crusher/resampler. 12dB LP, BP or HP filter. Waveshaper/distorter with 6 different wave shapes. Random preset button. Automation support. Smooth fader control.

SB - 101.name: SB - 101
SB - 101.description:
SB - 101 is a mono/poly one osc synth designed for bass and lead sounds. 
The oscillator can be used on its own for sine, saw, ramp, pulse, and noise waveforms, or as the carrier for frequency modulation and phase modulation synthesis. Sync can also be employed from the modulator to the carrier, for the phase sync sound or for more unusual effects. 
An ADSR envelope generator routes in either positive or negative variable levels to filter and pitch, as well as controlling the amplitude. An LFO, with several wave shapes, also is routable in positive or negative amounts to filter cutoff, filter resonance, envelope decay rate, and to the width of the pulse wave in the oscillator section. 
A classic style arpeggiator is also present, as well as glide and retrigger controls. Glide can be applied to the arpeggio, using an extended gate length. Finally, there is a built in simple delay. 
Unusual options on this instrument are: A separate output for the delay signal, which can be turned on in multi-channel hosts in order to have separate eq and FX for dry and effected output; and the ability to set a different midi channel for the arpeggiator for triggering it separately from the regular notes.

P-Deelay.name: P-Deelay
P-Deelay.description:
P-Deelay is a pattern based delay.
Features:
Six delay lines with multimode filter and panning per delay. Synced to BPM host in a pattern fashion. Buttons to deactivate the delay, mute the input or choose L or R as input. Internal limiters on every delay to be able to create distorted feedbacks without blowing up your speakers. PANIC button to lower all feedbacks at once. Input button: Turns input On/Off. Hints on all controls that makes the plug pretty self explanatory. MIDI automation and MIDI learn.

Tape Delay.name: Tape Delay
Tape Delay.description: A simple Tape Delay plug-in (Taken from the Dub Siren plug-in).

Rez.name: Rez
Rez.description:
Rez is a seemingly basic synth, but it's capable of a very wide range of sounds. While Rez has a bunch of cool features, the beating heart of Rez is its filter. It's made from multiple chained filters acting as a single powerful filter and it's highly resonant, providing Rez with its distinctive character. Top that off with distortion, a phaser, various oscillator modulations, delay, and a killer programmable arp and step sequencer, and you've got a powerhouse of a synth in a very small package.
From funky squishes, beastly basses, and screaming leads, to tight arpeggiations, swirling rhythms, atmospheres, bells, and interesting effects, you'll find it all here. Additionally, it comes with two skins - Yellow & Black, or Black & Yellow.
Features:
Virtual analog oscillators. Sub-oscillator. Detune (modulatable via aftertouch). Programmable phrase arpeggiator. Step sequencer (arp driven) with four mod destinations. Highly resonant low pass filter with velocity, LFO, and envelope modulation. "Age" control (noise to pitch). Two types of phase modulation. Beastly overdrive with three tone modes. Dual delay with stereo width adjustment. Phaser with optional LFO and velocity modulation. MIDI learn for all controls.

Random Pattern Delay.name: Random Pattern Delay
Random Pattern Delay.description: A pitched (i.e. very short) delay effect, with a pattern sequencer to control it. Not the most useful plugin, but you might find a place for it if you like weird electronic noises.

TapeIt 1.name: TapeIt 1
TapeIt 1.description:
Silverspike TapeIt 1 is a VST-Plugin to record audio streams creating wave files in real-time.
 You can plug TapeIt 1 into your VST host application at any point accepting VST plugins.
 While copying the sound unaltered from input to output, TapeIt writes it to a standard WAV file. This way you can grab any audio signal that appears at one of the plugin-points of your audio host.
Features:
 Manual and automatic recording level adjustment. Various WAV formats: 8, 16 and 24 integer, 32 bit float. 
 Uses: 
 Export accurate mix-downs. Record VSTis while playing. Bounce your tracks. Record dry and wet effect signals. Etc.

A-Pad.name: A-Pad
A-Pad.description:
An analog pad synth.
Features:
 2 oscillators (Each with its own ADSR). Detune. Phase mod. low/band/hi pass filter. Flanger and Panner, BPM delay (Can run free). 2 filter effects BPM synced or free running. Glide. Retrigger mono mode. 83 presets.

Psy-Drums.name: Psy-Drums
Psy-Drums.description:
Features:
 2 bass drums, 2 snares, 2 hi-hats, zap, tom, crazy tom, clap. BPM panners for the synths. The normal version has an BPM filter. Drive / distortion. Multi output and single stereo output versions.

OdOrgan.name: OdOrgan
OdOrgan.description: Phase mod. ADSR for filter and volume. Mono mode and 3 notes polyphony mode. 32 presets. Sine/Saw/Pulse/Triangle waveforms. Rotate. Percussion. 9 note polyphonic version available.

A-Sine.name: A-Sine
A-Sine.description: Uses only sine waves. 4 Phase Modulations. 4 Oscillators. ADSR filter and volume. Auto pan mix Osc a/b mix osc c/d. 100 presets.

Mocheese.name: Mocheese
Mocheese.description:
Features: 
One Oscillator. Arpeggiator. Ring Modulator. Distortion. Delay unit. VCF-ADSR (Low Pass, High Pass, Band Pass, Band Reject). VCA-ADSR. Envelope Amount. Keytracker. Modulators: Sample And Hold, LFO, VCF-ADSR, VCA-ADSR, Envelope Amount. Modulation destination: Ring Modulator, Distortion, Delay, Cutoff, Resonance, Volume.

Bandisto.name: Bandisto
Bandisto.description: Multi-band (3 band) distortion. Creates the sound of torn bass bins and other subtle effects.

BeatBox.name: BeatBox
BeatBox.description: If you want to replace sounds on a drum track with some other sound, this is a really difficult and unreliable plug-in to use. But if you want to make some random techno noises it's fine for that.

Combo.name: Combo
Combo.description: Amp simulator with several speaker models.

De-ess.name: De-ess
De-ess.description: mda De-ess is a high frequency dynamics processor.

Degrade.name: Degrade
Degrade.description: Sample quality reduction - Adjust bit depth, sample rate, and non-linearity.

Delay.name: Delay
Delay.description: Simple stereo delay with feedback tone control.

Dither.name: Dither
Dither.description: Apply all the standard dither types with fine adjustment of dither level and noise noise shaping, and a "zoom" function for auditioning the result.

DubDelay.name: DubDelay
DubDelay.description: Delay with feedback saturation and time/pitch modulation.

Dynamics.name: Dynamics
Dynamics.description: mda Dynamics is a Compressor / Limiter / Gate

Envelope.name: Envelope
Envelope.description: Envelope follower / VCA. Most useful in a modular VST environment like AudioMulch.

Image.name: Image
Image.description: Stereo image adjustment and M-S encoder/decoder

Leslie.name: Leslie
Leslie.description: mda Leslie is a rotary speaker simulator.

Limiter.name: Limiter
Limiter.description: mda Limiter is an opto-electronic-style limiter.

Loudness.name: Loudness
Loudness.description: Equal loudness contours for bass EQ, Also useful for mix correction.

Multiband.name: Multiband
Multiband.description: Multi-band compressor with Mid/Side processing modes.

Overdrive.name: Overdrive
Overdrive.description: mda Overdrive is a soft distortion plug-in.

Re-Psycho!.name: Re-Psycho!
Re-Psycho!.description: Drum loop pitch changer - Roughly slices the incoming audio and changes the playback speed of the slices.

RezFilter.name: RezFilter
RezFilter.description: Resonant filter with LFO and envelope follower.

RoundPan.name: RoundPan
RoundPan.description: Autopan that pans the signal in a circle around your head, if you sit in the right place in front of the speakers.

Splitter.name: Splitter
Splitter.description: Frequency and Level crossover for setting up dynamic processing. Good for a modular VST environment like AudioMulch or a grid system like TC's.

Stereo.name: Stereo
Stereo.description: Synthesizes a mono signal into stereo, using comb filtering or "Haas effect" delay.

SubSynth.name: SubSynth
SubSynth.description: Several low frequency enhancement methods to add a sub octave to bass or drums.

Talkbox.name: Talkbox
Talkbox.description: High resolution vocoder, for a more natural, less electronic sound than traditional vocoders.

TestTone.name: TestTone
TestTone.description: Signal generator with pink and white noise, impulses and swept sines.

ThruZero.name: ThruZero
ThruZero.description: Classic tape-flanging simulation - the sound disappears as playback positions of the two "tape machines" cross each other.

Tracker.name: Tracker
Tracker.description: Pitch tracking oscillator with pitch tracking EQ mode.

Vocoder.name: Vocoder
Vocoder.description: Switchable 8 or 16 band vocoder with separate "VocInput" plug-in for adding a pitch-tracked oscillator to input vocals. An earlier and less sophiscticated version of the Cubase Vocoder.

CM-303.name: CM-303
CM-303.description: TB303 alike. CM303 uses the same engine as the Muon Tau Bassline Mk2 but lacks the assignable MIDI controllers and "Accent" features and has a different GUI. Developed by Muon Software

Nokia Audio Suite.name: Nokia Audio Suite
Nokia Audio Suite.description:
The Nokia Audio Suite  is an integrated mobile audio authoring tool designed to offer one integrated environment for all Nokia's mobile audio development needs when used with a sequencer. In addition to the main plugin (Nokia Audio Suite 2.0) with complete feature set, the package contains two other software products (Auralisation tool and The Lights Editor) for more limited tasks only. 
VST Audio plug-ins Nokia Audio Suite 2.0 is an authoring tool designed for use by audio professionals who create audio content for mobile devices. More specifically, NAS 2.0 allows its user to monitor, analyze, create, and edit the SP-MIDI, MobileDLS and MobileXMF format types of audio content. Lights Simulation and editor, a feature of NAS 2.0, can be used to create content for and simulate the Nokia Lights Feature enabled phones. 
Auralisation tool plug-in auralises (or models) the audio content the way it would sound when played through the speaker of a mobile device taking into account physical properties of the mobile device (such as cover, hardware components used). Note that there may be differences between PC speakers. 
Standalone program The Lights Editor is an application for creating and editing Lights Configurations within MIDI files. 
Features of the Nokia Audio Suite 2.0: 
Creation and editing of SP-MIDI, mobile XMF and mobile DLS files, including a WAV-editor. Project tree with the copy / paste of data from one audio-file to another allows fast development of multiple music files. The possibility for playback of (edited) mobile audio files in the plugin itself, without export. Combined use of a Nokia's phone's sound bank and auralisation profile. Includes two original synthesizers used in Nokia phones for playback. Integrated environment for editing and simulating midi lights data. Project file written in the XMF-format. Vibra activity indicator. Supported Nokia phone models: 2650, 3100, 3200, 3220, 3230, 3300, 3510, 3510i, 3650, 5100, 5140, 6020, 6100, 6170, 6220, 6230, 6230i, 6260, 6600, 6610, 6630, 6650, 6670, 6800, 6820, 7200, 7210, 7250, 7270, 7600, 7610, 7650, 7710, 9300, 9500, N-Gage, N-GageQD.

DigiDrum Classic.name: DigiDrum Classic
DigiDrum Classic.description:
DigiDrum Classic is a simple mono-timbral drum module. 
Features:
  27 classic drum and percussion sounds / 52 factory presets.  New user-friendly GUI features.  Full MIDI CC# and VST automation of all parameters.

Multi Delay.name: Multi Delay
Multi Delay.description:
Multi Delay is a Multi Channel Filter Delay Plugin.
Features:
Up to 10 individual Channels with a Delay and a Filter. Notch, Lowpass, Highpass and Bandpass Filter. Every parameter can be modulated by a LFO or by steps (in sync with the host app). Works on mono, stereo or multi-channel (VST only) tracks. Altivec optimized.

Tune It!.name: Tune It!
Tune It!.description:
Tune It! helps to tune any instrument (guitar, bass, sax, flute...). It can also be used to monitor the pitch in real time.
Features:
 Automatic Note Recognition (from A-1 to A6). Programmable A440 reference from 400 to 480Hz (step of 1Hz or 0,1Hz). Programmable Precision/Latency (very low, low, medium, high, very high) The lower the precision, the lower the latency.

Tapestop.name: Tapestop
Tapestop.description:
Tape Stop simulates the effect you get when you turn off a tape recorder or a turntable with the sound still on. 
Modes:
 EP(vinyl) - EP is normal mode, TD (Tape deck) - TD will back up the tape a bit when it stops. 
Adjustable display:
 N - normal R - reverse the button. 
Adjustable button:
 T - toggle D - Direct return to play when mouse button is released. 
Adjustable speed:
 Select the DOWN speed by clicking on the LEFT mouse button in the speed box, then hold and drag. Select the UP speed by clicking on the RIGHT mouse button in the speed box, then hold and drag.

Music Studio Independence / Producer.name: Music Studio Independence / Producer
Music Studio Independence / Producer.description:
MSI is a MIDI/Audio sequencer/multitrack, basic features include: 
MIDI sequencer
 256 multi track + tempo, meter and key track(total 259 tracks). 64 MIDI input, 64 MIDI output. Max measure : 9999. Meter : 1/1~99/32. Resolution : 960. Tempo : 5~500. Data format : MSF(Music Studio File) and SMF format 0,1. 
Audio
 256 mono tracks. 8 stereo or surround busses. 44 insert and 54 stereo/surround effects (5 inserts per track). Output : 16ch(max). Input : 64ch(max). Frequency : 32kHz, 44.1kHz, 48kHz, 88.2kHz, 96kHz, 176.4kHz, 192kHz. Sample bits : 16bit, 24bit (32 or 64bit floating processing). Data format : MSF(Music Studio File), WAF(Wave Audio File) and wave file. Supports MME and ASIO.

Particle Fountain.name: Particle Fountain
Particle Fountain.description: Particle Fountain is a monophonic synth that attaches a sound (either a sawtooth or a square wave) to a bunch of particles, which move in a 2d space like a fountain. The particles' position in the space then determines certain aspects of the sound (frequency, amplitude, panning). There can be up to 200 particles in use at any one time.

Oxe FM Synth.name: Oxe FM Synth
Oxe FM Synth.description:
Features:
multitimbral (16 MIDI channels); 8 operators (6 oscillators, 1 noise generator/limiter, 1 filter), all with envelope; 1 LFO per channel; frequency modulation half-matrix with self-modulation; global reverb and delay; great general performance in low resources systems; a lot of good quality patches included (thanks to Annabelle, Summa and Teksonic); external skin support.

THD.name: THD
THD.description:
This is no typical high-gain distortion device, nor a 'decimator' or bit crusher but it is some sort of saturator. It is intended for a mixer's insert path to act as a preamp stage. It smoothes out the transients, gives more overall gain and warms a bit. 
On good days, it behaves similar to a tube input stage, adds some gentle warmth to the input signal, brings up the overall level and just sounds as if it's consisting of analog circuits. On bad days it creates muddiness, sounds confusing, crappy and digital as hell. 
Features: 
Soft Saturation Simulator. Gain, Punch, Clip shape & Output controls. +6dB-Switch (doubles the input level). Bypass.

Floorfish.name: Floorfish
Floorfish.description:
Floorfish is a simple expander / gate device, easy to set up and offers a broad variety of processing, ranging from slight expansion, background noise attenuation to extreme gating effects. 
What's different from similar units is the ability to scan the source and adjust the transition curve accordingly.

Blockfish.name: Blockfish
Blockfish.description:
Blockfish is a versatile compressor with countless ways to shape the incoming audio. Unlike many other digital compressors, Blockfish has 'soul'. It likes to bite, but it can be tamed easily once you've learned how to use its potential. 
You can remove the front plate and make further adjustments on the circuit board. Everything is possible: clean, transparent, loud, punchy, silky, subtle, fat. But still with a unique sonic character.

Spitfish.name: Spitfish
Spitfish.description: Spitfish is a dead-easy to use de-esser, aimed mainly at mono or stereo vocal tracks. Just like classic analog de-essers, this unit dynamically filters out harsh, annoying s-like sounds that would otherwise 'spit' in your face.

iDkILLER.name: iDkILLER
iDkILLER.description:
iDkILLER is a 16-note polyphonic synth that uses a single Phase Distortion Oscillator in place of the standard oscillator/filter, coupled to a powerful mono/poly UNISON set-up. It is designed for EBM/Industrial music but is versatile enough to be used anywhere. 
Features: 
1 x Casio-style Phase Distortion Oscillator [2 simultaneous waveforms]. UNISON mode allows stacking of up to 16 voices with detune/depan [mono/poly operation]. 6 stage Modulation Envelope with invert switch. BPM-synced LFO with 6 waveforms, including Sample & Hold, and 2 simultaneous destinations. Monophonic/Polyphonic operation. Portamento [mono only]. Miniature keyboard with toggle mode.

Kristal Audio Engine.name: Kristal Audio Engine
Kristal Audio Engine.description:
Kristal Audio Engine is a powerful multi-track recorder, audio sequencer and mixer - ideal for anyone wanting to get started with recording, mixing and mastering digital audio. 
It is designed as a modular system. The main application provides a mixing console, while the audio sequencer, live audio input and so on are loaded as separate PlugIns. 
Kristal Audio Engine is FREEWARE for personal, educational and non-commercial use. 
Features: 
16 audio tracks. 32 Bit floating point audio engine. 44.1 to 192 kHz sample rate*. Downmix to 16/24/32 Bit audio files. 3-band parametric EQ & 2 VST insert slots per channel. 3 VST master effect slots. ASIO low latency audio driver support. 4 Kristal PlugIn slots. Load/Save Kristal project files. Supported file formats: WAVE, AIFF, FLAC, OGG Vorbis. 
The following Plug-ins are included in the Kristal package: 
Kristal Waver 
The sequencer PlugIn for Kristal. Multi channel hard disk recording via ASIO/MME. ASIO input monitoring. Audio clip arrangement. Audio clip fade-in/fade-out/cross-fade. Unlimited undo/redo. AES31 Export. 
Kristal LiveIN 
Connect your mic/guitar and play thru Kristal using VST effects in real-time.

LightBag II.name: LightBag II
LightBag II.description:
Features:
 Emulation of a tonewheel organ/rotary speaker combination with nine drawbars, and extensive MIDI implementation for real time control. Paged panel design to access all parameters. Complete manual included.

Coyote Wah.name: Coyote Wah
Coyote Wah.description:
Coyote Wah is a VST plugin that implements high-quality sweeping resonant-filter (wah-wah) effects. Advanced audio processing algorithms produce a very clean output, free of artifacts. 
 Some of the unique features of the Coyote Wah are: 
 Emulation of 4 popular wah-wah pedals. Supports presets and automation. VU meter. Controllable by an external Midi controller (e.g. pedal).

FreeDelay.name: FreeDelay
FreeDelay.description:
FreeDelay is the LFO modulated delay from Helga as a separate VST effect plugin. 
Features: 
LFO modulation: The delay time can be modulated with a sinusoid Low Frequency Oscillator. Stereo: Adjustable phase difference between the left and right channel modulations. Low-pass filter: The feedback can be dampen with a low-pass filter. Modes: Tempo sync 3/2, 1/1, 2/3, Smooth Mode and Tunable to MIDI note.

ndcTrem.name: ndcTrem
ndcTrem.description: ndcTrem is a simple tremolo with tempo-sync capabilities.

ndcTrem+.name: ndcTrem+
ndcTrem+.description: ndcTrem+ is an updated version of ndcTrem (a simple tremolo with tempo-sync capabilities), which allows you to choose where in the oscillator's cycle it is reset to on the bar start, and also allows you to use it as an auto-panner.

Dominion.name: Dominion
Dominion.description:
If you were searching for a tool to shape the envelope of a signal, giving you total control of the signal's attack & sustain phase, dominion is certainly something for you. 
Features: 
Envelope section. Adjust attack & sustain independently, regardless of input level. Plus, you have control over the envelopes' time constants. Imagine pulling a drummer up front or pushing him to the background by dragging just a single slider. Feel like moving the walls around him? Again, a single push enhances the room information or can make the sound really dry. Saturation stage. Following digitalfishphones tradition, the plugin can help to reduce harshness often associated with digital recordings, giving back some warmth and life to your source by modeling classic analog equipment. The tonal character stays adjustable within a broad range. High frequency details section. Similar to classic exciter circuits, this section allows you to brighten up a signal, giving transparency and depth by generating additional harmonics. Non-clipping output stage. Like the endorphin compressor, a brickwall waveshaper circuit ensures that the output won't exceed -0.1dBFS, while remaining sonically clean.

Normalizer.name: Normalizer
Normalizer.description:
Ever heard of the denormalisation problem? 
Upgraded to a P4 processor and got problems with load spikes like never before?. Does a certain plugin consume all available CPU power whenever there's NO signal coming in (or out)?. 
Denormalisation is an issue with some audio hosts that don't switch off the plugin's audio task when the song is stopped or a track contains silence (or with instruments: no key is pressed while a sound decays). 
The problem happens when the CPU (precisely: the floating point unit (FPU) inside of it) detects extremely small numbers and wishes to process them with the same precision as usual. Then it switches into 'denormal' mode which is another way of representing small floating point numbers with the available bit range. Converting between the two states takes a lot of time for the FPU and thus might cause heavy load jumps. 
Some algorithm such as delay lines and filters are prone to denormalisation as they work with feedback structures. Here, if an impulse is followed by absolute silence, the resulting signal gets smaller and smaller but in theory, it can never reach zero. In practice, there is an internal threshold of the FPU that switches to denormal mode to carry on processing those small numbers (which might not be of any use for proper operation). 
Normalizer is a small plugin that should cancel out those numbers and ensure a trouble-free sequencing of your songs.

Endorphin.name: Endorphin
Endorphin.description:
Features: 
Two independent frequency bands (low and high frequency processing). Switchable stereo or M/S mode operation. Two basic compressor designs: Modern VCA mode with soft-knee characteristics and manual time constants. This mode provides an instant response behaviour and deep compression, using a feed-forward circuit. Vintage-style opto (photo resistor) mode, modeled after ancient opto-electrical compressors. The time constants stay manually set, but they are also affected by the signal's energy. This mode has the typical opto-style 'overshoot' on quick transients, this is one of the most gentle compressors you may find. Classical feed-back detector circuit.  Adjustable high-level output stage with analog-style saturation. Global 'de-comp/sat' section. It's you  who decides how the unit reacts to large amounts of gain reduction as well as when  and how  to saturate. Maximum output: -0.1dBFS. This is very helpful when using the plugin as the last stage before burning the CD.

Peak Compressor.name: Peak Compressor
Peak Compressor.description:
Features:
Soft compression. Look ahead processing. Non-linear release curves. No pumping or coloration. Normalization. 32-bit internal precision. Sample rates up to 96 kHz supported. 16-bit dithering. Low CPU usage. Sinus Wave Display Interface (SWDI). Supports automatic latency compensation. Direct numeric input. Full parameter automation. Built-in limiter. RMS display. AntiDistortion fader.

FilterONE.name: FilterONE
FilterONE.description:
Features:
3 Filter types (Buz LPF / IIR LPF / IIR HPF).BPM Synced LFO.

AnalogicDelay.name: AnalogicDelay
AnalogicDelay.description:
A plugin for all ex-Logic-user who miss the logic tape delay, brought to you by www.echochamber.ch and www.interruptor.ch 
Features: 
Tape model including tape saturation, wow & flutter, low and high pass filtering, smooth parameter for continuous delay time changes like on a real tape delay. MIDI learn: Each control can be automated via MIDI controllers. The default assignment of MIDI controllers is documented in the pop-up hints. To assign a different controller right-click on a control then choose "Learn" from the pop-up menu and twiggle the hardware controller you want to assign. Alternatively choose "Unlearn" or "Edit.." to assign a controller from a list.

BionicDelay.name: BionicDelay
BionicDelay.description:
This enhanced version of the Analogic Delay gives you separate control over the delay times on left and right channel. Suitable for ping pong delays and drifting delays. 
Features: 
Tape model including tape saturation, wow, flutter, low and high pass filtering. Separate control of delay time for left and right channel. The delay time is not entered in milliseconds but as a note length (in relation to the song tempo in your sequencer). The Groove parameter allows fine tuning from triplet to dotted note timing. "Drift" parameter gives you the possibility to create delays wandering to the left or to right in the stereo field. Press the "Ping Pong" button to create delays alternating between left and right speaker. Parameter "Smooth" creates continuous delay time changes like on a real tape delay (no digital clicks when changing delay time during the song). MIDI learn: Each control can be automated via MIDI controllers. The default assignment of MIDI controllers is documented in the pop-up hints. To assign a different controller right-click on a control then choose "Learn" from the pop-up menu and twiggle the hardware controller you want to assign. Alternatively choose "Unlearn" or "Edit.." to assign a controller from a list.

Aqua.name: Aqua
Aqua.description:
Aqua is a warm sounding polyphonic analogue synthesizer with:
 2 Oscillators. 2 LFOs with multiple routings. Tempo synced delay. Serial or Parallel Filter. Arpeggiator.

Subtrakt 5.1.name: Subtrakt 5.1
Subtrakt 5.1.description:
Subtrakt 5.1 is a 6 Oscillator Surround Synth VSTi that allows you to use the creative possibilities of 5.1-surround sound within the process of sound design. 
There are two oscillators for each front and rear and an additional oscillator for the center and one for the LFE (subwoofer) channel. Multimode-filters for each surround-stage and a total of three LFOs allow for interesting and complex sound textures. The arpeggiator is BPM-synchronized to the host application, so rhythmic gating-effects are easy to create. All parameters of Subtrakt 5.1 can be controlled via MIDI-controllers and are available for VST-automation. 
Although designed for a 5.1 monitoring system, Subtrakt 5.1 works fine in any stereo environment as well.

DX Reverb Light.name: DX Reverb Light
DX Reverb Light.description:
DX Reverb Light is based on a reduced version of the DX Reverb. DX Reverb Light allows you to simulate anything from small rooms with sudden attacks and coloration characteristic of small spaces to large natural-sounding spaces with spread attack and build of a concert hall.
It contains only one simplified algorithm of the 11 algorithms that are available with the full DX Reverb. DX Reverb Light doesn't support MIDI, while the DX Reverb features full MIDI implementation for parameter automation and preset recall via standard MIDI messages.
Main features:
True stereo reverbs that will not affect stereo imaging. 64-bit internal precision. 24-bit/96kHz audio support. Highly optimized DSP code. Ultra clean and noiseless processing. Factory presets. Parameter automation (depending on host application). Stereo out (mono->stereo, stereo->stereo).

DetectComp.name: DetectComp
DetectComp.description:
Features:
Realtime multi-criterion numerical analysis : High and low velocity. Stereo deviation. High and low frequency mean. Compression statistical indicator. Peak and RMS progressive values.  Velocity Distribution computation. Frequency Distribution computation. Velocity and frequency evolution (20'' / 8' periods).

K-Tuner.name: K-Tuner
K-Tuner.description:
K-Tuner is an audio frequency analyzer, mainly designed for tuning musical instruments. It has some extra functionality for guitar players, but it is suitable for any instrument - acoustic or electronic. 
K-Tuner reads streaming audio data and analyzes it to find out the current frequency. Frequency and it's equivalent musical note are then printed on a digital type of screen, amongst some other details.

FuzzPlus3.name: FuzzPlus3
FuzzPlus3.description:
FuzzPlus3 is a ground-up rewrite of the popular FuzzPlus series. It features the same much-loved vintage fuzz pedal model, plus a new filter, self-feedback, and a modern procedural user interface.
Features:
Accurate digital model of a vintage distortion pedal's circuitry. Resonant low-pass filter modeled on the MS20 analog synthesizer. Self-feedback control for exploring new sonic territory (In less pretentious language: feeds the output back to the input, which sounds cool on some stuff, and farty on other stuff. Your mileage may vary). Cross-platform XML-based preset mechanism for easy sharing and saving of presets. Animated procedural OpenGL-based user interface. No bitmaps were harmed in the making of this plug-in. Surround-capable for all formats up to 7.1, for all your surround-sound distortion needs.

ParisEQ.name: ParisEQ
ParisEQ.description:
The Paris VST EQ is a 4-band stereo parametric VST equaliser plugin utilising the same algorithm as the E-mu/Ensoniq Paris system. It offers the same musicality and quirkiness as the original including soft-limiting, grungy distortion ability, and resonant behaviour under certain conditions. 
Previously only accessible to those who owned the Paris custom DSP hardware, this unique EQ is now available to all PC DAW users. Paris users will also appreciate finally being able to have the same high quality EQ available on both native and card submixes.
 4-band fully parametric EQ. Switchable EQ type per band - High pass, high shelf, peaking, low shelf, or low pass. Adjustable cut/boost for shelving and peaking types, and adjustable bandwidth (in octaves) for peaking type. Adjustable trim at output, allowing for level adjustment and saturation effects. Phase-reverse and all EQ in/out switches. 64-bit internal precision. Enough character to be an instrument unto itself.

C3 Multi Band Compressor.name: C3 Multi Band Compressor
C3 Multi Band Compressor.description:
Features:
 Three stereo compressors. A master limiter. Flexible dividing filters(ButterWorth Filter or LinearPhaseFIR Filter). Sampling Rate: 44.1k, 48k, 88.2k, 96k support. 32bit float internal precision.

P1-Tapedelay.name: P1-Tapedelay
P1-Tapedelay.description:
Features:
 Screaming analog overdrive on high feedback. Smooth parameter control. High/low cut filter & tape speed modulation. Also shows time in beats (normally 1/4 note). Variable phase feedback for phaser sounds.

Retro Delay.name: Retro Delay
Retro Delay.description:
Retro Delay is a flexible all round delay effect in VST format. It has the character and sound of a vintage delay unit but features many modern options. Besides delays, it can produce a wide range of modulation, chorus, flanger and phaser effects. 
Features: 
Independent left and right channel delay lines. BPM synced or manual times (up to 6 seconds). Forwards or backwards delays. X-feedback (ping pong). '1 feedback pass', there will always be 1 feedback. Optional negative feedback for phaser/flanger effects. Optional short delay times for phaser/flanger effects. Integrated automatic limiter. 2 BPM synced LFOs 1 modulates filter cutoff, the other the delay time. (only available for forwards delay). 4 LFO modes, sine, triangle, ramp, envelope follower. LFO, left/right channel inverse options.  24dB/oct resonant filter placed in the feedback path - Switchable lowpass, bandpass, highpass, low shelf and high shelf mode. Saturation - Saturate and limit parameters, 2 different types. Old-school spring reverb - Size, color and mix parameters, Optional mono mode. Fade out option, when using high feedback settings - Fade out time parameter. Pitchbend wheel, for smooth delay time changes.

Murmur.name: Murmur
Murmur.description:
Murmur allows up to 8-step sequencing of two independent, parallel multimode filters. At each sequence step, both the cutoff frequency and resonance value of each filter can be set. The sequencer automatically synchronizes to the tempo of the VST host. 
The Steps and Size controls effectively set the time signature of the cycle: Div of "4th" and Steps of 3 are 3/4 time, etc. A bank of indicator lights shows the current sequence step. 
Features: 
2 variable-cutoff resonant filters offering 12dB/octave lowpass, highpass, bandpass, and notch modes as well as a 24dB/octave lowpass mode. Syncs to host tempo, sequencing up to 8 steps of durations from 64th note to double whole note. Full control of filter frequency and resonance for each filter and sequence step. Compact and straightforward custom GUI.

SupaPhaser.name: SupaPhaser
SupaPhaser.description:
By Bram @ Smart Electronix
 3 to 23 stage phaser with feedback. Phaser operation is controlled by a mixture of LFO and envelope follower, both configurable. Enhanced stereo effect. Pre-phaser distort or saturate.

s(M)exoscope.name: s(M)exoscope
s(M)exoscope.description:
By Bram @ Smart Electronix. 
s(M)exoscope is an oscilloscope VST plugin. You can use it to visually monitor audio wave forms. 
Features: 
Available as a Standard insert effect or as a special Modular version optimized especially for modular VST hosts like Plogue Bidule or AudioMulch. Display controls - Time (number of pixels per sample) & Amp (amplitude of the waveform in the display). Retrigger modes - Free, Internal, Rising & Falling - with Retrigger Threshold. External mode also available in the modular version. Options - Sync Redraw, Freeze, DC-Kill & Channel. 
The s(M)exoscope also contains a tool that can be used to analyze the waveform currently in the display. Based on where you place a marker, the tool analyzes the x and y dimensions of the waveform to calculate the following: 
Selection amplitude (linear). Selection amplitude (decibels). Selection length (in samples). Selection length (in seconds). Selection length (in milliseconds). Selection frequency (assuming that the selection is one cycle in length).

Speedster.name: Speedster
Speedster.description:
Speedster is an Audio Units effect plugin that pitch shifts and time-stretches in real-time. A clever algorithm allows for controlling (and automating) pitch and speed independently. 
It can also perform stereo/center separation, so that the user has independent control not only of the right and left side of the signal, but also of the center.

Reversinator.name: Reversinator
Reversinator.description:
Reversinator, a "simplistic realtime audio-reversing plugin". 
The input audio is read into a 88200-sample buffer, which has two read pointers (going in the opposite direction of the write pointer), half the buffer apart. The sound from each pointer is mixed according to a raised cosine type envelope, to ensure the volume is constant, and that you never hear the discontinuity between the previous data and the new data being written in.

arp4midi.name: arp4midi
arp4midi.description:
arp4MIDI combines Chris Kerry's arpeggiator with contemporary synchronization functions, adding gate offset (e.g. early or late) host position based sync, and "lobster" ("humanize") functions. arp4MIDI includes arpeggiate and phrase modes and a 16 step sequencer assignable to gate or arpeggiator step.
arp4MIDI is included when you purchase Talent.

q2midi.name: q2midi
q2midi.description:
q2midi is a 'note generator' - when any gate signal is received, an algorithmic sequence set to key and rhythmic specifications is output along your MIDI chain. The q-engine is the same as employed in xoxos q-series VST instruments, now applicable to any instrument. 
Two more 'layers' of randomization are 'nested' around the gate and pitch generators for creating complex patterns that repeat or transpose motifs, or don't. q2midi also includes a separate assignable CC# control in addition to gate, pitch and velocity output. 
q2midi is bundled with arp2midi as a $5 bundle.

OldSkoolVerb.name: OldSkoolVerb
OldSkoolVerb.description:
OldSkoolVerb is a freeware algorithmic reverberation AU and VST plug-in for professional music production applications. This plug-in implements a kind of "classic" stereo reverb algorithm which is technically simple yet optimal. It also produces a very clear spatial image that blends well with the mix.
OldSkoolVerb offers you a comprehensive set of parameters permitting you to achieve various reverbs ranging from plate to hall reverb sound. OldSkoolVerb is best suited for non-percussive and soft-attack sounds like vocals, piano and pad sounds.

Abacus.name: Abacus
Abacus.description: A synth which can make sounds of the 80's digital synths but can also turn its hand to percussive or plucked tones.

echographz.name: echographz
echographz.description: Echographz is a dual stereo delay line with tempo synchronization. Delay time and pan settings are adjusted by dragging small red and blue circles, Delay feedback and volume are set by dragging the light text in the side panels.

VstSeq.name: VstSeq
VstSeq.description:
VstSeq is a simple "piano roll" style pattern sequencer VSTi host actually designed to run as a plugin in Tuareg 2 but it also has a stand alone version. 
Features: 
 Simple piano roll pattern sequencer: 1 - 8 measures. 2 - 32 steps per measure.  30 - 303 BPM. Loads multiple VSTi. Save/Render as WAV.

GarageBand.name: GarageBand
GarageBand.description:
GarageBand for Mac turns your Mac into a simple any time, anywhere recording studio. It's the easiest way to create, perform and record your own music on a Mac whether you're an accomplished player or just wish you were a rock star.
Key features:
Record with any USB or MIDI keyboard, guitar or microphone. Mix your track using professional effects and settings. Use thousands of included pre-recorded loops to add "virtual musicians". Make your guitar sound like it's playing through your favorite vintage amp. 
GarageBand for iPad, iPhone and iPod touch turns your iDevice into a collection of Touch Instruments and a full-featured recording studio — so you can make music anywhere you go. Use Multi-Touch gestures to play pianos, organs, guitars, drums, and basses on your iDevice. They sound and play like their counterparts, but let you do things you could never do on a real instrument.

SPAN.name: SPAN
SPAN.description:
SPAN is a real-time "fast Fourier transform" audio spectrum analyzer plug-in for professional music and audio production applications. For the most part it was derived from Voxengo GlissEQ dynamic parametric equalizer and reproduces its spectrum analysis functionality.
Features & Compatibility:
Output signal power statistics. K-metering. Internal channel routing. Undo/redo history. Clipping statistics. Multi-channel analysis. Channel grouping. A/B comparisons. Correlation meter. Mid/side analysis. Preset manager. Contextual hint messages.

KusoSynth.name: KusoSynth
KusoSynth.description: ADSR Amp Envelope.Waveform, Kuso (Tone-deaf), Portamento, Release and Volume controls.ToneMorph harmonics envelope control.8 voice polyphonic.English and Japanese interface.

SynthFont.name: SynthFont
SynthFont.description:
SynthFont 1 is a free tool for playing/rendering MIDI files using SoundFonts and other similar sound sources (WAV, DLS, GIGA and also VST Instruments).
SynthFont2 is the second generation of SynthFont and has a number of new features and improvements. It costs €15.
SynthFont is intended to mimic the behavior of SoundFont compatible hardware/soundcards like SoundBlaster Live! or Audigy and SynthFont is (almost) modulator aware, which Live! is not. But SynthFont is more. It provides an interface into the SoundFont structure and has basic editing capabilities. It also displays various data about the loaded MIDI file through the piano roll and the event list. Finally, there is a simple playlist feature for storing the files you are currently working on.
SynthFont also supports VST effects - there are 17 busses in all: one master bus and 16 channel busses.
VSTSynthFont (VSF), a separate VST instrument version of SynthFont is also available.

IxoxFlute.name: IxoxFlute
IxoxFlute.description: SF2 based flute. 3 articulations : normal, staccato, percussive. Up to 3 velocity layers. 3 octaves, 4 notes per octave (full length no loop). Dirty vocal noise can be mixed with the flute sound. Possibility of a second flute that follows the main one. Fully automatable.

Wave!.name: Wave!
Wave!.description: Wav file synthesizer. 24 Note polyphony. ADSR Envelope Generator. Coarse and Fine Tuning. Level Control with Output Overload Indicators. Pan Control. Full Automation. User Assignable Automation Capability.

Font!.name: Font!
Font!.description: SoundFont synthesizer. 24 Note polyphony. ADSR Envelope Generator. Coarse and Fine Tuning. Level Control with Output Overload Indicators. Pan Control. Full Automation. User Assignable Automation Capability.

Sinthecyza!1.name: Sinthecyza!1
Sinthecyza!1.description: Single FM operator synthesizer.  4 patchable host synced LFOs.  4 patchable HAHDSR envelope generators with LFO timed triggering and output level control.

Sinthecyza!2.name: Sinthecyza!2
Sinthecyza!2.description: Dual PD oscillator synthesizer. 4 patchable host synced LFOs. 4 patchable HAHDSR envelope generators with LFO timed triggering and output level control.

Sam!.name: Sam!
Sam!.description: 24 file wave player.  Mixer Section.  Fwd/Rev/Loop play.  Start/End Position Sliders with Fine Adjustment and Cue Markers. Stereo channel swap. ADSR envelope generators on each player. Selectable MIDI note triggering. 8 patchable 12db Biquad LP/HP/BP/Notch filters with Level controls.  6 Level adjustable Stereo outputs (version 1.2) or Single Level adjustable Stereo output (version 2.1)  Default position reset on all rotary controls and sliders.

FiltSeq.name: FiltSeq
FiltSeq.description: FiltSeq is a 16-step 4-sequencer stereo/mono state variable filter with independent timing for frequency, resonance and left/right channels.

MIDISeq!.name: MIDISeq!
MIDISeq!.description:
MIDISeq! is a 64-Step MIDI Data Sequencer.
Features:
 User Selectable 2-64 Step Sequencer. Draw and Single Step editing. Step / Interpolation control. All Step Randomise. Host Locked / Free Run operation. Scalable MIDI Output. Normal Loop / Sync Reset / Single Step / Triggered Single Sequence modes. User selectable MIDI Channel / Note / CC input triggering. Manual BPM Override. Data Output Reduction. MIDI Thru Channel Router. Global MIDI Reset. User Assignable Automation capability.

Stringer.name: Stringer
Stringer.description:
Stringer is an emulation of classic string synths such as: 
Eminent 310. Mellotron. Arp string ensemble. Crumar Performer. Korg Trident. 
Features: 
Low CPU demands. Filter. MIDI automation. 20 presets.

Puff n Pys.name: Puff n Pys
Puff n Pys.description:
Features:
 Drum Synth with Kick, Snare, Rim, Clave, HiHat, Crash, Ride & Tambourine. Filters on snare and kick. Low CPU demands MIDI automation. Multi out, first 2 stereo out then separate channel for each instrument.

BuzComp Free GranComp3.name: BuzComp Free GranComp3
BuzComp Free GranComp3.description:
BuzComp GranComp3 is a Multiband Classic Hard Compressor/Limiter.
Main features:
 3 analog type EQ for multi-band compressor. SonicFilter add various sound characters or saturation for input signals. 2 types gain reduction (Fat/Tight). Auto/Manual release control. Peak limiter for master output.

reViSiT.name: reViSiT
reViSiT.description:
reViSiT integrates a Tracker sequencing environment with the VST host sequencer application: receiving synchronization information directly from the host, and returning high-quality 'tracked' audio. The net result is that the composer can retain the familiar sequenced tracks and "multi-tracking" audio utilities of the host, while simultaneously benefiting from the advantages offered by trackers. 
The Professional Edition adds several features - notably surround sound, flexible output and audio bus routing, pattern management, and MIDI-controlled pattern playback. For a limited period, it is available for a special introductory price of £24.99 (roughly €29 / $39). A comparison table of the features available in the Standard (Free) and Pro versions can be viewed here.

EZ-Poly.name: EZ-Poly
EZ-Poly.description:
EZ-poly has an 8 step analog sequencer which syncs to your hosts tempo, or can be stepped with each new note, creating some fantastic tones and note-runs. 
EZ-poly comes equipped with 30 presets from Tim Conrardy showing this synth off to its fullest.

Kanun.name: Kanun
Kanun.description: Kanun is a VSTi which produces a Kanun sound, with a user interface to enable instant middle-eastern scale conversion.

Nay.name: Nay
Nay.description: Nay is a VSTi which produces a Nay sound, with a user interface to enable instant middle-eastern scale conversion.

Oud.name: Oud
Oud.description: Oud is a VSTi which produces an Oud sound, with a user interface to enable instant middle-eastern scale conversion.

Buffer Synth Alpha.name: Buffer Synth Alpha
Buffer Synth Alpha.description:
Buffer Synth Alpha is a lo-fi performance effect. It reads the audio input into a buffer, and when it receives a MIDI note, plays back the contents of the buffer at the pitch of the note. Checking the Freeze Buffer parameter will stop the plugin reading audio into its buffer while the MIDI note is held, giving the familiar 'stuck buffer' effect. 
Note that this is not an 'alpha-version' but a finished plugin.

Juno 6.name: Juno 6
Juno 6.description:
Juno 6 is an open source VSTi that emulates the sound of the original Roland Juno 6/60 Synthesizer. The project itself is based on the ultramaster juno 6 linux sources. 
The source is released under the GNU public license (GPL).

ASynth.name: ASynth
ASynth.description:
by Antti of Smart Electronix
ASynth is a six voice virtual analog synthesizer featuring two oscillators and three circuit modelled filters. 
Features:
 6 Voice polyphony. 2x/4x/8x selectable oversampling. MIDI CC automation. Two oscillators:  Osc 1 with sawtooth and square waveforms. Osc 2 with sawtooth and pulse waveforms.   Three circuit modelled filters:  MS20: 12 dB/oct lowpass filter with signal level dependent resonance. Mini: 24 dB/oct lowpass filter from the 60's. XPander: Multimode 24 dB/oct filter with 16 different responses.   Two ADSR envelopes (VCF and VCA). One LFO with 6 waveforms.

Example Synth.name: Example Synth
Example Synth.description: Example Synth is a very basic (user interface wise and synth-engine wise) FM synthesizer created as an example of Stefan's Jewel user interface framework. It may not be too useful in its current state as there are some common features missing (e.g. no MIDI controller support yet) and it may still contain some bugs.

MultiFXVST.name: MultiFXVST
MultiFXVST.description:
MultiFXVST is a free Windows effect chainer that loads as a VST effect in your VST host and can also host, and chain, VST effect plug-ins itself.
Features:
Up to 127 chains of effects. Unlimited number of effects in one chain (Limited by the power of your computer). Re-use plug-ins between chains. MultiFXVST and VST plugin parameters are controllable through MIDI messages and VST automation.

2WarpDelay.name: 2WarpDelay
2WarpDelay.description:
2WarpDelay pairs two warped-lattice IIR filters with a pair of delay lines and a bitmap which it scans to extract filter coefficients. 
A stereo signal is fed through two delay lines followed by a warped IIR lattice filter. The lattice filter can be of any order from 1 to 80 and uses reflection coefficients extracted from an image. This output is fed through a saturation stage and a ducking / limiting stage before being fed back, again, into the delay lines. The lattice filter is warped, and by adjusting the warping parameter its frequency response can be easily adjusted. 
Resonance controls the distance between spectral peaks and spectral valleys in the filter transfer function, and cutoff controls the cutoff of a first-order low pass filter that follows the lattice filter.

Mutant Koto.name: Mutant Koto
Mutant Koto.description:
Mutant Koto is a simple VSTi that implements a plucked string model using two strings that can be detuned and coupled, first-order loop filters on each, controllable quantization of the coupled signal (called 'leakage' in the synthesizer) and a warped IIR lattice filter applied either to the leakage or to the output stage. 
The maximum order of the warped lattice is 30 and the preset filters were derived to very roughly model some of the body resonances of the named instruments, along with a formant filter and some random filter choices. 
Other features: 
Microtuning support. MIDI CC control of some key parameters.

qWarpFilter.name: qWarpFilter
qWarpFilter.description:
qWarpFilter allows the user to perform a warped LP analysis of the input signal for each of four independent filter banks, where after the user can warp between all four filters using the XY touchpad control or use the 'filter warp' slider to change the warping in the filtering stage. 
The results tend towards bellish sounds or weird sleeping sounds reminiscent of the EMU Morpheus' filters.

mWarped Linear Prediction Filter.name: mWarped Linear Prediction Filter
mWarped Linear Prediction Filter.description:
The Warped LPC filter plugin simulates the structure of a warped linear-predictive codec implemented with warped lattice filters. 
Linear prediction coding 'whitens' a signal by performing a spectral analysis and filtering out peak components. The output can then be used as the input to a similar reconstruction filter that adds the spectral peaks removed in the first step. 
Warping the frequency scale of the predictor allows for the frequency scale to match the human auditory system. Individual adjustment of the warping parameter at each stage allows the user to create interesting effects by filtering using a frequency-dependent adaptive filter, and filter coefficients can be rotated to create bizarre phasing effects.

SpatSynth 8.name: SpatSynth 8
SpatSynth 8.description:
Subtractive synth: 
 2 oscillators 1 multimode resonant filter 3 LFOs 2 envelopes Frequency modulation and synchro between the two oscillators 8 modulated outputs with gestual control of the most important parameters associated with spatial movements. 10 notes polyphony.

Dreamer.name: Dreamer
Dreamer.description:
Features:
 ADSR for volume. ADSR for filter with envelope tracking hi mix band mix. Cutoff and resonance. Uses 4 oscillators all with phase modulation depth/octave/tune. The oscillators has octave/tune and volume. You can choose between sine/saw/pulse/triangle/ramp. It has a filter crosser and a panner. Slicer/flanger/filter slicer and a BPM delay.

Unknown Synth.name: Unknown Synth
Unknown Synth.description:
Features:
 2 oscillators plus 2 for the phase modulation. The first oscillator has detune and octave settings. The 2nd also has detune. Every osc has his own phase mod depth, the phase mod also has octave settings and you can choose note tune or normal tune. 2 filter ADSRs with low/hi band and 4pole. BPM filter sync or free. BPM panner sync or free. Bass Boost. 2 BPM delays. 128 presets. The sequencer can control octaves or filters. Trancegate. Arpeggiator.

Sweepie.name: Sweepie
Sweepie.description: Sweepie is a filter rotating plugin.

BassLane.name: BassLane
BassLane.description:
Basslane is used to narrow the stereo width of low frequencies in tracks and mixes. It's a simple, yet handy utility that allows you to regain bass tightness and prevent "muddy" mixes caused by a too wide low end. 
 Basslane is also very useful when mastering and especially when mastering for vinyl records. It allows you to transparently prevent problematic stereo content in the low frequencies. The easy-to-use interface features a range of monitoring options allowing precise fine tuning while auditioning the processing at different stages. 
 Key Features: 
Easy to use. Transparent stereo sound with classic pan response. 6/12 dB/oct filter switch for variable filter steepness. Width sweepable from full stereo to full mono. Useful auditioning modes.

ChordworX Free.name: ChordworX Free
ChordworX Free.description:
ChordworX takes a single note and triggers up to 7 notes to make up complete chords/arps. There are 98 pre made chords including various inversions ranging from standard min/maj/dominants to more Jazzier diminished and augmented chords, you can also add your own. 
ChordworX works best in modular hosts like EnergyXT but can also be used in any host that sends MIDI to effect plugins.

Arpecyza!.name: Arpecyza!
Arpecyza!.description:
Arpecyza!1 is a 16 Step Arpeggiator Synth with a built in loop recorder.
Features:
 Dual Single Oscillator Synths with HADSR Envelopes. 24db LP Filters. 16 Note Host Synced Arp Sequencer with Note Slide. 6 Patchable Host Synced Parameter Sequencers (3 per Synth). 3 Patchable Host Synced LFOs. MIDI Note Message Transpose. Shuffle Control. Auto Start/Stop Stereo Wave Recorder with Peak Meters. Manual Recording Level and Balance Controls. Manual BPM Override. Partial Automation. User Assignable Automation Capability.

Snip.name: Snip
Snip.description:
Features: 
Virtual analog semi-modular monophonic synthesizer. Experimental sound generator. Rich monophonic sounds. 3 LP/HP filter. 2 osc driven by 2 LFO and a micro-sequencer. Modulatable delay time.

Quadropolis.name: Quadropolis
Quadropolis.description:
The Quadropolis Surround-Plugin is a VST effect Plugin dedicated to Quadraphonic Music. There was a lot of research on Quadraphonics back in the early 70s. 
This Plugin simulates an anechoic chamber with 4 loudspeakers in it (starting from 45° in 90° steps). Within the soundfield there is - of course - the listeners head, which is simulated with a 512 Tap HRTF-Convolver (FIR-Filter). This causes high CPU-Load (about 50% @2GHz, but improvements are on the way). 
The plugin gives you the ability to mix your quadraphonic music, without using 4 loudspeakers. Only Headphones are needed. Just put the plugin (with 4 Inputs and 2 Outputs) at the end of the mixing chain and enjoy panning the music around.

Blood Bucket.name: Blood Bucket
Blood Bucket.description: Blood Bucket is apparently a pointless experiment in synthetic stupidity. Two oscillators are combined in a variety of ways to modulate a third oscillator and presets are named after parts of the human head.

Bad Cable.name: Bad Cable
Bad Cable.description: Bad Cable is an AudioUnit which attempts to simulate a bad audio cable. The result is a form of waveform distortion. With some settings, the effect sounds like FM radio when you're at the edge of reception (check out preset #2 "FM Edge").

Rider.name: Rider
Rider.description:
rider is an AudioUnit which automatically rides the gain to keep the RMS output level as consistent as possible. The gain is only changed at a maximum of.5dB per second, so there should be no apparent breathing. This plug-in is useful for mastering, broadcast, or just plain listening. 
The only parameter is the Target RMS Level, which defaults to -14dB. 
NOTE: There is no limiting of the output, so peaks may exceed 0dB. If you experience clipping in your material, either reduce the Target RMS Level, turn down the master volume, or insert an appropriate limiter plug-in after rider.

Overflow.name: Overflow
Overflow.description: Overflow is an AudioUnit which generates digital bit overflow distortion. Much like early ADC chips would react to excessive input levels by overflowing the available word length.

Photon.name: Photon
Photon.description:
Photon is a hybrid synth with an with an experimental 'warp' engine for creating evolving rhythmic sequences, random arpeggios and classic Sample&Hold style arcade weirdness.
Features:
2 oscillators with sync and FM.Warp section for S&H arpeggiation.Warp can be set to NoteSync for pitch.5 envelopes: Amp, Filter, Mod 1&2, Audio Input.Each envelope can be triggered by the Warp.3 assignable LFOs with high/low limit controls.Dual Stereo Delay section.Assignable modwheel and pitchbend.External Audio Processor.64 presets.Includes MIDI CC Chart.

TubeBaby.name: TubeBaby
TubeBaby.description: TubeBaby is a digital simulation of a tube guitar amplifier. As such it features the standard controls found on a real amplifier, namely gain, bass, mid, treble, presence, master and, as the latest addition, a switch for activating the high gain mode of the preamp stage.

NyquistEq.name: NyquistEq
NyquistEq.description:
By Magnus @ Smart Electronix. 
NyquistEq is a paragraphic equalizer that does not suffer from the treble warping that most digital equalizers do. Also it never clicks, and it handles deep bass well. 
The reason it's called NyquistEq is because it's designed to be a filter that sounds good all the way up to the Nyquist frequency (if sampling rate is 44.1 kHz then nyquist is at 22.05 kHz).

MjCompressor.name: MjCompressor
MjCompressor.description:
By Magnus @ Smart Electronix. 
MjCompressor is a single band compressor which reacts with different speeds depending on the frequency content of the signal, achieving a cleaner more responsive sound.

Analog Box.name: Analog Box
Analog Box.description:
Analog Box is a low level, circuit based, modular software synthesizer. You put sound objects on the screen, connect them together, listen and adjust. When you find something you like, you can record it to a wav file, or just save the circuit and play it again later.
ABox is somewhat like the vintage synth's of the '70's in that there are separate modules with lots of patch cords, knobs, buttons and displays. But you also get the computational ability offered by modern CPU's. Features like FFTs, Differentials and Digital Control open up realms of sound design never dreamt of before. With the advanced capabilities offered by VSTi, USB/HID, MIDI and DirectShow you could conceivably play your favorite video soundtrack through a plugin adjusted by a glove controller.
With ABox2, editing virtual circuitry has never been easier. Get objects from the palette, put them where you want, connect them however you like. Adjust parameters using one click popup panels then move on. No questions asked. Make a mistake ? Hit Undo, all fixed. Like that section of circuitry ? Clone it, now you have another one. Really like that section of circuitry ? Group it together, create a new object. Now you can paste it anywhere.

SoulRush.name: SoulRush
SoulRush.description:
The SoulRush VST and DXi interfaces enable you to use SR Instruments in VST or DXi Hosts. 
These interfaces are free add-ons to the SoulRush family, which are not free, and should be downloaded at the same time as the other products if required. 
Current SoulRush instruments: 
Chaosynth: Synthesizer module. Uses Granular synthesis driven by Cellular Automata. Ice: Synthesizer module. Uses subtractive synthesis for a wide general purpose sound set.

Fernando.name: Fernando
Fernando.description: 3 waveform oscillators with pitch, tuning, LFO, waveshaper, filter, plus ADSR envelopes. Effects - Distortion, Flanger, Delay. HP filter. Arpeggiator. Mod/pitch wheel and joystick controller.

BassLiner.name: BassLiner
BassLiner.description: 2 oscillators. LFO. LP/HP/BP filters. ADSR amp env.

Linear Phase Graphic EQ.name: Linear Phase Graphic EQ
Linear Phase Graphic EQ.description:
Features:
 Consists of a LinearPhaseFIR. 61 frequency bands. Parametric EQ mode available. Sampling Rate: 44.1k, 48k, 88.2k, 96k support. 64bit float internal precision.

ARPocalypse.name: ARPocalypse
ARPocalypse.description: ARPocalypse is a 6 note, 8 step matrix pattern generator. Taking a MIDI input it outputs the notes of the chord in a rhythmic sequence defined by the user - with the output notes, velocity, gate time, swing and legato programmable for each step.

Topaz Clav1.name: Topaz Clav1
Topaz Clav1.description: Topaz Clav1 is a Clavinet Sample Player with a Dynamic Multi Mode Filter Section.

Topaz E.P.1.name: Topaz E.P.1
Topaz E.P.1.description:
Topaz E.P.1 is a Fender Rhodes 73 Sample Player. 
Features: 
Three Layers Soft, Mid, Hi. Built in Host Synced Tremolo. Six Stage Stereo Phaser. Individual level for each layer. Low/Pass Moog Filter.

DH/Topaz Channel Sampler.name: DH/Topaz Channel Sampler
DH/Topaz Channel Sampler.description: DH/Topaz Channel Sampler grabs live Audio. It loads as an insert effect and lets you sample from a channel and then play back the audio in one simple plugin; ideal for recording CPU intensive VST plugins.

RS Stereo Delay.name: RS Stereo Delay
RS Stereo Delay.description:
RS Stereo Delay is a simple and flexible delay effect that features the standard controls such as Delay-Time, Feedback, Pan, Dry/wet and a Cross Feedback Controller. It offers two independent sections which can be also used as one mono section or can be combined with by a Link Switch.
Features:
 Two Independent Sections. Cross Feedback Controller. High cut Filter. Some presets such as Flanger, Doubling, etc.

RS Phase Reverse.name: RS Phase Reverse
RS Phase Reverse.description: RS Phase Reverse offers simple 180° Phase Reverse.

RS Exact Delay.name: RS Exact Delay
RS Exact Delay.description:
The idea behind RS Exact Delay is a 100% accurate computation of the deceleration time in consideration of the effects of temperature on the speed of sound.
"Exact Delay" is primarily designed to solve problems caused by the time differences of different microphone signals. It allows you to enter the distance in centimeters and it generates, in relation to the temperature and the speed of sound, the necessary delay time automatically.

BuzComp Free GranComp.name: BuzComp Free GranComp
BuzComp Free GranComp.description:
BuzComp GranComp is a Classic Hard Compressor/Limiter.
Main features:
 SonicFilter add various sound characters or saturation for input signals. 2 types gain reduction (Fat/Tight). Auto/Manual release control. Peak limiter for master output.

Shisaku.name: Shisaku
Shisaku.description: 3 VCOs (SIN, TRI, SAW, SQR, SAWSIN, SQRSIN, EP, ORG, SAW(BLIT), SQR(BLIT), TRI(BLIT), White Noise, Pink Noise. LP, HP, BP, Notch, LP24dB and HP24dB filter types.  ADSR envelope for VCA & VCF and ADR for VCP. Largest simultaneous pronunciation several 16 Effects - Distortion, Flanger, Phase Shifter, and Stereo Delay.

LFX-1310.name: LFX-1310
LFX-1310.description:
LFX-1310 is a multi-effect plug-in for Windows including 24 algorithms and 3 serial slots.
Effects:
S'Filter 12 / S'Filter 24 / 3-band EQ. Peak Compressor / RMS Compressor. Overdrive / Distortion / Amp Distortion. Crusher / LP Noise / Stereo Image. Chorus / Flanger / Phaser / Auto Wah / Tremolo / Auto Pan. Delay / Stereo Delay / Ping-pong Delay. Gate Reverb / Room Reverb / Hall Reverb / Spring Reverb. 
Features:
24 algorithms. 3 serial-routed slots. 128 factory presets. HLMS : Hyper Layered MIDI assign System for real-time performance and sound editing. FOEM : Fully Optimized Effecting Module.

ProtoPSG.name: ProtoPSG
ProtoPSG.description:
Specification
 8 voice polyphonic PSG like VSTi.2 OSCs and 1NoiseGenerator.1 Envelope Generator.

Parameters
 OSC-A/B  FORM(24,25): WaveForm Select OCT(28,29): Octave. -2 to +2 VOL(20,21): Volume ADJ(31): detune between OSC-A and OSC-B S&H LV(32): sample&hold modulation level S&H RATE(33): sample&hold modulation speed NOISE  FREQ(27): Noise Frequency VOL(23): Noise Volume ENVELOPE  FORM(40): Envelope Form selection RATE(41): Envelope speed FILTER  FREQ(74): Cutoff RESO(71): Resonance SWEEP(37): Cutoff modulation level (no modulation if center) RATE(38): Cutoff modulation speed EG LFO(39): Cutoff modulation mode EG=one shot, LFO=repeat POL/MON(126): Mono Mode enable PORTA(5): PortamentoLFO  RATE(76): LFO speed PITCH(77): LFO-Pitch modulation depth.  A(85): OSC-A modulation enable. B(86): OSC-B modulation enable. PWM(79): LFO-PWM modulation depth.  A(87): OSC-A modulation enable. B(88): OSC-B modulation enable. CHORUS(93): Chorus Depth DELAY(91): Delay Depth VOL(7): Master Volume PAN(10): Pan

Physically - Modelled Drum.name: Physically - Modelled Drum
Physically - Modelled Drum.description:
Physically-Modelled Drum is a simple physically-modelled (rectangular) drum VSTi.
 The controls correspond to the physical parameters of the drum; Stiffness is the stiffness of the membrane, Initial Displacement is how much the membrane is moved initially, Mass is the mass of the membrane, Viscosity is the friction of the air (set it to 0 for a continuous sound), and Output From is the specific node in the 2d grid from where the output is read from.
